newsitem.title: USA: Intuit CFO shifts to new job at company.
newsitem.headline: Intuit CFO shifts to new job at company.

text.p: Intuit Inc said James Heeger, chief financial officer, will switch positions to head up the company's Small Business Division, and Greg Santora, vice president of finance, will become acting CFO.

In a statement issued late Monday, Intuit said Heeger's new title will be senior vice president and general manager of the division, responsible for QuickBooks accounting products and the Financial Supplies Group.
Heeger joined Intuit in August 1993, and was vice president and general manager of the Financial Supplies Group before becoming chief financial officer.
In his new position, Heeger replaces John Monson, who becomes an Intuit Fellow. Monson will focus on strategic planning and management development.

Greg Santora will continue as vice president of finance in addition to being named acting CFO. Intuit said it will begin searching for a senior vice president of finance, administration and customer support to replace Heeger.
